<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This file implements generic type expansion and splitting for LegalizeTypes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The routines here perform legalization when the details of the type (such as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// whether it is an integer or a float) do not matter.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Expansion is the act of changing a computation in an illegal type to be a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// computation in two identical registers of a smaller type.  The Lo/Hi part</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is required to be stored first in memory on little/big-endian machines.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Splitting is the act of changing a computation in an illegal type to be a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// computation in two not necessarily identical registers of a smaller type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are no requirements on how the type is represented in memory.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These routines assume that the Lo/Hi part is stored first in memory on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// little/big-endian machines, followed by the Hi/Lo part.  This means that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">      SplitInteger(BitConvertToInteger(GetScalarizedVector(InOp)), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2bac1a5298f939e87e8f962a5edfc206918">Hi</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a> = DAG.getNode(ISD::BITCAST, dl, NOutVT, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7f2a3d4dcfee70225988aec53ff1e173">report&#95;fatal&#95;error</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Scalarization of scalable vectors is not supported.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a35dc101b509721ffbfb58aba316de681a5290057031a9bc71850f61e757cb940e">TargetLowering::TypeWidenVector</a>: &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!(InVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#ae245d70802e4ebe1cae2b6122c62a22a">getVectorNumElements</a>() &amp; 1) &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unsupported BITCAST&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">      InOp = GetWidenedVector(InOp);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">      EVT LoVT, HiVT;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (TLI.hasBigEndianPartOrdering(OutVT, DAG.getDataLayout()))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a> = DAG.getNode(ISD::BITCAST, dl, NOutVT, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Handle cases like i64 = BITCAST v1i64 on x86, where the operand</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is legal but the result is not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumElems = 2;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal">    EVT ElemVT = NOutVT;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal">    EVT NVT = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a210ba6b43ba451b698857dd9de71bd15">EVT::getVectorVT</a>(&#42;DAG.getContext(), ElemVT, NumElems);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If &lt;ElemVT &#42; N&gt; is not a legal type, try &lt;ElemVT/2 &#42; (N&#42;2)&gt;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!isTypeLegal(NVT)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewSizeInBits = ElemVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a45e76d44a189e456d52e37ba3dda0fce">getSizeInBits</a>() / 2;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the element size is smaller than byte, bail.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NewSizeInBits &lt; 8)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0; i &lt; NumElems; ++i)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> e = Vals.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>(); e - Slot &gt; 2; Slot += 2, e += 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Lower the bit-convert to a store/load from the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(NOutVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a470621733f1ffb597e6f502040216da4">isByteSized</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Expanded type not byte sized!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Create the stack frame object.  Make sure it is aligned for both</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the source and expanded destination types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In cases where the vector is illegal it will be broken down into parts</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and stored in parts - we should use the alignment for the smallest part.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/hsamd/kernel/arg/key/#a6b334a5f83504ebc99cc59f4f333ff98">Align</a> InAlign = DAG.getReducedAlign(InVT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;UseABI=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/hsamd/kernel/arg/key/#a6b334a5f83504ebc99cc59f4f333ff98">Align</a> NOutAlign = DAG.getReducedAlign(NOutVT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;UseABI=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/hsamd/kernel/arg/key/#a6b334a5f83504ebc99cc59f4f333ff98">Align</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/hsamd/kernel/arg/key/#a6b334a5f83504ebc99cc59f4f333ff98">Align</a> = std::max(InAlign, NOutAlign);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#aa8c11d016a2dd473a4cf0ed1da777f5eaf80f5476044d70697d689c8f32415ce9">StackPtr</a> = DAG.CreateStackTemporary(InVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a1572b31fadbd0d758314b8d35a050410">getStoreSize</a>(), Align);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SPFI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;FrameIndexSDNode&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#aa8c11d016a2dd473a4cf0ed1da777f5eaf80f5476044d70697d689c8f32415ce9">StackPtr</a>.getNode())-&gt;getIndex();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachinePointerInfo PtrInfo =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo/#ad8ce1aee13dbdcc05d20284a30e83170">MachinePointerInfo::getFixedStack</a>(DAG.getMachineFunction(), SPFI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Emit a store to the stack slot.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/spii/#ad2b7483c625986ac800ae1c31ae4cce7a36b3dd3b84fde3f8494a9b18af131856">Store</a> = DAG.getStore(DAG.getEntryNode(), dl, InOp, StackPtr, PtrInfo);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Load the first half from the stack slot.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a> = DAG.getLoad(NOutVT, dl, Store, StackPtr, PtrInfo, NOutAlign);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Increment the pointer to the other half.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IncrementSize = NOutVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a45e76d44a189e456d52e37ba3dda0fce">getSizeInBits</a>() / 8;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#aa8c11d016a2dd473a4cf0ed1da777f5eaf80f5476044d70697d689c8f32415ce9">StackPtr</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal">      DAG.getMemBasePlusOffset(StackPtr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize/#a003b4369b4130e669dc9139798e0193c">TypeSize::getFixed</a>(IncrementSize), dl);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Load the second half from the stack slot.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2bac1a5298f939e87e8f962a5edfc206918">Hi</a> = DAG.getLoad(NOutVT, dl, Store, StackPtr,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal">                   PtrInfo.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo/#a9459055a98e20980521289e8d20fcc7e">getWithOffset</a>(IncrementSize), NOutAlign);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Handle endianness of the load.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (TLI.hasBigEndianPartOrdering(OutVT, DAG.getDataLayout()))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getValueType(0).isVector() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOperand(0).getValueType().isInteger()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An illegal expanding type is being converted to a legal vector type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make a two element vector out of the expanded parts and convert that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instead, but only if the new vector type is legal (otherwise there</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is no point, and it might create expansion loops).  For example, on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x86 this turns v1i64 = BITCAST i64 into v1i64 = BITCAST v2i32.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: I&#39;m not sure why we are first trying to split the input into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a 2 element vector, so I&#39;m leaving it here to maintain the current</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// behavior.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumElts = 2;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal">    EVT OVT = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOperand(0).getValueType();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">    EVT NVT = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a210ba6b43ba451b698857dd9de71bd15">EVT::getVectorVT</a>(&#42;DAG.getContext(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal">                               TLI.getTypeToTransformTo(&#42;DAG.getContext(), OVT),</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!isTypeLegal(NVT)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we can&#39;t find a legal type by splitting the integer in half,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
